name: In the Matter of R. J. P.

parties: In the Matter of R. J. P.

opinions.text:
ORDER
Treating the petition for writ of prohibition as a petition for certiorari, said petition is hereby granted. Petitioner’s application for stay of proceedings in the Family Court is granted until further order of this court.

attorneys: Michael D. Coleman, Child Advocate, Warwick, Patricia Beede, Rhode Island Legal Services, Inc., for plaintiff-respondent.
John Edward Farley, Chief Legal Counsel, Dept, for Children and Their Families, Providence, for defendant-petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
In the Matter of R. J. P.
No. 80-525-M.P.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
Jan. 5, 1981.
Michael D. Coleman, Child Advocate, Warwick, Patricia Beede, Rhode Island Legal Services, Inc., for plaintiff-respondent.
John Edward Farley, Chief Legal Counsel, Dept, for Children and Their Families, Providence, for defendant-petitioner.
